basics.name: Matvey Zhuchkov
basics.label: Backend Developer (Intern)
basics.summary:
I am a Computer Science student focused on server and cloud technologies. I have practical, hands-on experience in Linux server administration (Ubuntu, Nginx, SSH) and a solid foundation in C#, C++, and Python.

I am seeking a summer internship opportunity to apply my skills to practical challenges in the FinTech, Telecom, or Cloud Services sectors.

My immediate professional goal is to deepen my knowledge of ASP.NET Core and Docker to build a personal portfolio website.

education.institution: Nizhny Novgorod State Technical University n.a. R.E. Alekseev (NNSTU)

projects.name: Performance Research of Struct vs. Class in C#
projects.description: A research project focused on a comparative performance analysis of structs and classes in C#. The project involved creating test scenarios and benchmarks to identify optimal use cases for each data type.
highlights: Implemented tests to measure object creation and data access speed.
Analyzed the performance impact of various usage scenarios.
Formulated recommendations for choosing between struct and class based on the specific task.

projects.name: Game Process Automation
projects.description: Developed a set of Python scripts to automate actions in multiplayer online games. The project involved the following tasks:
highlights: Analyzed network traffic and protocols to understand client-server communication logic.
Applied basic reverse engineering methods to interact with the game client without a public API.
Configured and administered virtual machines to create isolated and stable environments for the scripts.

projects.name: School Project: Telegram-based VPN Service Concept
projects.description: Developed a service concept using Telegram as a platform to create a virtual private network. This project demonstrates an understanding of networking protocols and API integration principles.
highlights: Designed a client-server architecture using the Telegram Bot API.
Analyzed methods for traffic encapsulation and ensuring security.
The project was awarded a prize at a school science conference.
